text: We're going to show you all the ways
to block numbers from your Samsung Galaxy.
Use the clickable sections below

to keep track of your
steps during this tutorial.
If you know who you want to block,
you can block them from your contacts app.
First, open the contacts app,
then tap on the contact you wish to block.
Tap "More," then tap "Block contact."
Tap "Block" to confirm.
If you want to block a number
that's not in your contacts,
first, open the phone icon.

Tap the three vertical dots
in the upper right corner,
then tap "Settings."
Tap "Block numbers."
Enter the phone number you want to block.
Then tap the plus sign to add the contact
to your block list.
If you would like to block a number
that recently called,
you could also go to the "Recents" section
in the phone app

and then tap the phone
number you want to block.
Tap "More," then tap "Block contact."

To block unknown numbers
from calling your phone,
tap the phone icon.

Tap the three red dots
at the top of the screen.
Then tap "Settings" in the drop-down menu.
Tap "Block numbers,"
and then toggle the button

beside the "Block unknown
callers" to green.
